info.title: Cloud Logs API
info.x-cli-description: Manage the IBM Cloud Logs Service.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/alerts/${id}"

example.description: Alert when the number of logs reaches a threshold.
example.name: Test alert

source: curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
"${base_url}/v1/alerts/${id}"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Alert ID

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/alerts"

getAlertsOptions := logsService.NewGetAlertsOptions()

alertCollection, response, err := logsService.GetAlerts(getAlertsOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(alertCollection, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

example.description: Alert when the number of logs reaches a threshold
example.name: Test alert

parameters.name: type

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/outgoing_webhooks?type=ibm_event_notifications"

listOutgoingWebhooksOptions.SetType("ibm_event_notifications")

outgoingWebhookCollection, response, err := logsService.ListOutgoingWebhooks(listOutgoingWebhooksOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(outgoingWebhookCollection, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

  --header "Accept: application/json" \

    "type": "ibm_event_notifications",
    "name": "Event Notifications Integration"

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/policies?enabled_only=true&source_type=logs"

getCompanyPoliciesOptions := logsService.NewGetCompanyPoliciesOptions()
getCompanyPoliciesOptions.SetEnabledOnly(true)
getCompanyPoliciesOptions.SetSourceType("logs")

policyCollection, response, err := logsService.GetCompanyPolicies(getCompanyPoliciesOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(policyCollection, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

post.summary: Run a query to search the logs
post.description: Run a query to search the logs. Note that this is a SSE (Server Sent Events) API and the content type of the response is text/event-stream

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: text/event-stream" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data   '{
    "query": "source logs | limit 10",
    "metadata": {
      "start_date": "2024-05-01T20:47:12.940Z",
      "end_date": "2024-05-02T22:47:12.940Z",
      "tier": "frequent_search",
      "syntax": "dataprime",
      "limit": 100,
      "strict_fields_validation": false
    }
  }' \
  "${base_url}/v1/query"

post.summary: Submit a background query to be processed asynchronously.
post.description: Submits a query that runs in the background, allowing the client to continue without waiting for the results immediately.

source:
curl -X POST --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{ "query": "source logs | filter $d.apiVersion == 42", "syntax": "dataprime_utf8_base64" }' \
  "${base_url}/v1/background_query"

get.summary: Get the status of a background query
get.description: Get the status of a background query

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/background_query/${query_id}/status"

parameters.name: query_id
parameters.description: Generated query ID that can be used to obtain the status and results of a background query.

schema.description: Generated query ID that can be used to obtain the status and results of a background query.

get.summary: Get the data of a background query
get.description: Retrieves the result of a previously submitted background query using its query ID.

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: text/event-stream" \
  "${base_url}/v1/background_query/${query_id}/data"

parameters.name: query_id

schema.description: Generated query ID that can be used to obtain the status and results of a background query.

get.summary: Get service instance's Data Access Rules by ids
get.description: Get service instance's Data Access Rules by ids

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Array of data access rule IDs

schema.description: Array of data access rule IDs

items.description: Array of data access rule IDs

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/data_access_rules?id=4f966911-4bda-407e-b069-477394effa59"

listDataAccessRulesOptions := logsService.NewListDataAccessRulesOptions()
listDataAccessRulesOptions.SetID([]strfmt.UUID{"4f966911-4bda-407e-b069-477394effa59"})

dataAccessRuleCollection, response, err := logsService.ListDataAccessRules(listDataAccessRulesOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(dataAccessRuleCollection, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

example.description: Data access rule intended for testing
Data access rule intended for testing

source:
dataAccessRuleFilterModel := &logsv0.DataAccessRuleFilter{
  EntityType: core.StringPtr("logs"),
  Expression: core.StringPtr("<v1> foo == 'bar'"),
}

updateDataAccessRuleOptions := logsService.NewUpdateDataAccessRuleOptions(
  CreateMockUUID("3dc02998-0b50-4ea8-b68a-4779d716fa1f"),
  "Test data access rule",
  []logsv0.DataAccessRuleFilter{*dataAccessRuleFilterModel},
  "<v1>true",
)
updateDataAccessRuleOptions.SetDescription("Data access rule intended for testing")

dataAccessRule, response, err := logsService.UpdateDataAccessRule(updateDataAccessRuleOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(dataAccessRule, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))
curl -X DELETE --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
"${base_url}/v1/data_access_rules/${id}"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the data access rule to be deleted

schema.description: ID of the data access rule to be deleted

get.summary: Get data usage metrics export status or return data usage report
get.description:
Get data usage metrics export status when invoked without query parameters.
Get daily or detailed data usage report when invoked with query parameters.

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: The range of days to retrieve data usage, by default it will use current month

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to filter daily or detailed the data usage, by default it will use daily one

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/data_usage?range=last_week&query=detailed"

curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/data_usage?range=last_week&query=daily"

curl.name: Example request to get metrics export status

source:
curl -X GET --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  "${base_url}/v1/data_usage"

exportDataUsageOptions := logsService.NewExportDataUsageOptions()
exportDataUsageOptions.SetRange("last_week")
exportDataUsageOptions.SetQuery("daily")

exportDataUsageResponse, response, err := logsService.ExportDataUsage(exportDataUsageOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(exportDataUsageResponse, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

put.summary: Update data usage metrics export status
put.description: Update data usage metrics export status

source:
curl -X PUT --location --header "Authorization: Bearer ${iam_token}" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data   '{
    "enabled": true
  }' \
  "${base_url}/v1/data_usage"

parameters.name: id

schema.description: The ID of the Event Stream.

put.x-cli-table-filter-jmespath: {Name:name, ID:id, Status:is_active, Brokers:ibm_event_streams.brokers, DpxlExpression:dpxl_expression, Topic:ibm_event_streams.topic, CompressionType:compression_type, CreatedAt:created_at, UpdatedAt:updated_at}

source:
ibmEventStreamsModel := &logsv0.IbmEventStreams{
  Brokers: core.StringPtr("kafka01.example.com:9093"),
  Topic: core.StringPtr("live.screen"),
}

updateEventStreamTargetOptions := logsService.NewUpdateEventStreamTargetOptions(
  int64(0),
  "Live Screen",
  "<v1>contains(kubernetes.labels.CX_AZ, 'eu-west-1')",
)
updateEventStreamTargetOptions.SetCompressionType("gzip")
updateEventStreamTargetOptions.SetIbmEventStreams(ibmEventStreamsModel)

stream, response, err := logsService.UpdateEventStreamTarget(updateEventStreamTargetOptions)
if err != nil {
  panic(err)
}
b, _ := json.MarshalIndent(stream, "", "  ")
fmt.Println(string(b))

ApiError.description:
ApiError is a message in a standardized error response format.
 It contains a list of individual errors, a trace identifier, and a status code.

status_code.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

value.description: Only logs with this ApplicationName value will match the rule constraint.
Only logs with this SubsystemName value will match the rule constraint.

RulesV1SeverityConstraintValue.description: Only logs with this severity value will match

RulesV1RuleMatcher.description: Optional rule matchers. If matched, the rule is processed by the rule group.

rule.description: Regex which will parse the source field and extract the JSON keys from source field while retaining the original log

RulesV1JsonExtractParametersDestinationF.description: The metadata field used to store the extracted value

rule.description: Regex which will extract a JSON parameter from  the source field

destination_field.description: The field used to store the modified text

replace_new_val.description: The value replacing the matched text.

rule.description: Regex which will match parts in the text to replace

destination_field.description: The field to store the parsed text

rule.description: Regex which will parse the source field and extract the JSON keys from it while removing the source field

keep_blocked_logs.description: If true, matched logs will be blocked, otherwise matched logs will be kept

rule.description: Regex which will match the source field and decide if the rule will apply

keep_blocked_logs.description: If true, matched logs will be kept, otherwise matched logs will be blocked

RulesV1ExtractTimestampParametersFormatS.description: The time format to be used for the extracted time value

format.description: The time format of the source field being extracted.

RulesV1RemoveFieldsParameters.description: Parameters for the remove fields rule

fields.description: Json field paths to drop from the log

items.description: Json field paths to drop from the log

destination_field.description: The destination field where the JSON stringified content will be placed.

delete_source.description: Whether or not to delete the source field after running this rule

destination_field.description: Destination field where the JSON object will be placed.

delete_source.description: Whether or not to delete the source field after running this rule

override_dest.description: The destination field where the JSON stringified content will be placed.

RulesV1RuleParameters.description: Parameters specifying how a rule runs

RulesV1Rule.description: Rules to run on the log

id.description: Unique identifier of the rule

description.example: Extracts the service and region from the source field

source_field.description: The field value used to execute the rule

enabled.description: Whether or not to execute the rule

order.description: The ordering of the rule subgroup. Lower order will run first. 0 is considered as no value

RulesV1RuleSubgroup.description: Rule subgroups. The first rule subgroup will be executed first. If there is no match, subsequent rule groups will be attempted until there is a match. Rule groups are attempted in order.

id.description: The ID of the rule subgroup

rules.description: Rules to run on the log

enabled.description: Whether or not the rule subgroup is enabled

order.description: The ordering of the rule subgroup. Lower order will run first. 0 is considered as no value

id.description: The ID of the rule group

name.description: The name of the rule group

description.example: Rule group to extract severity from logs
description.description: A description of the rule group. The description will describe the purpose of the rule group.

enabled.description: Whether or not the rule is enabled

rule_matchers.description: Optional rule matchers which, if matched, will process the rule through the rule group

rule_subgroups.description: Rule subgroups. The first rule subgroup will be executed first. If there is no match, subsequent rule groups will be attempted until there is a match. Rule groups are attempted in order.

Cardinality limit
This is the limit for the number of unique values in a field. If the number of unique values in a field is greater than this limit, the field will be excluded from the results. This is a warning and not an error. The query will still run.

name.description: The name of the alert definition

description.example: Example of unique count alert from terraform
description.description: A detailed description of what the alert monitors and when it triggers

enabled.description: Whether the alert is currently active and monitoring

group_by_keys.description: Keys used to group and aggregate alert data. Not supported for `logs_new_value` alert type.

items.description: Keys used to group and aggregate alert data

phantom_mode.description:
Whether the alert is in phantom mode (creating incidents or not)
Phantom alerts serve as building blocks for flow alerts without triggering independent notifications. 
Enabling this will remove the 'Notifications' section from the alert definition.

deleted.description: Whether the alert has been marked as deleted

AlertDefinition.description: Response model for a given alert definition

id.description: This is the alert definition's persistent ID (UniqueIdentifier). This ID does not change when the alert is updated.

created_time.description: The time when the alert definition was created

updated_time.description: The time when the alert definition was last updated

alert_version_id.description: The previous or old alert ID

description.example: Example of unique count alert from terraform

enabled.description: Whether the alert is currently active and monitoring. If true, alert is active.

items.description: Keys used to group and aggregate alert data

phantom_mode.description: Whether the alert is in phantom mode (creating incidents or not)

deleted.description: Whether the alert has been marked as deleted
